Skill Required: Basic Electronics Circuits designing 
Event details: The event is based upon the real world Soccer. In this event, there will be a sponge ball that one team has to guide into opponentâ€™s goal box. The game would require a team to build robots based on their own unique designs. The event will be organized in a closed room so that the external factors (like wind) will not affect the outcome of the game. 

Rules: 
1.Each team can have a maximum of four players. 
2.The game will have the number of rounds based on the number of participant teams. 
3.Knocking off another robot without the ball in possession or in act of possession will lead to a foul. 
4.If the ball goes out of arena due to one team, the other gets to continue from the spot. 
5.The game will be divided into two halves, each being 10 minutes long. 
6.Drop ball rules shall also take effect when necessary. 
7.If the game ends in a draw, an Extra time of 5 minutes will be provided to score. 
8.If the game still results in a draw, both teams shall take their goalkeepers off (if more than one player(s) are available). Golden Goal rule shall take effect for the decision. 
9.The organizers may alter the rules as required, and their decision will be final. 
10.Misbehavior or use of foul language during the game shall lead to immediate disqualification. Bot Specifications: 
11.A bot can have a maximum of 30 x 30 x 30 cm^3 dimensions. 
12.Each bot can be a maximum of 10 kilograms in weight. 
13.Shooting/ sweeping mechanism is allowed for all robots. Gripping/ lifting mechanisms are not permitted. 
14.Bot can be wired or wireless 
15.External AC supply of 220V will be provided. 
16.The maximum voltage permitted for each bot should not be greater than 12V, if found otherwise, will lead to disqualification. 

Scoring: 
1.Each goal scored will give +10 points to the scoring team. 
2.Each foul will lead to -3 points to the same team. 
3.A goal scored from its own half directly will lead to +15 points to the scoring team.
